name: TRIP REPORT | Flair Airlines Boeing 737-400 (PLUS SEATS) Calgary to Winnipeg
description:
The Ultra-Low Cost Carrier (ULCC) market is starting to heat up in Canada. Flair Airlines is one of the players in this market, founded in 2005 as a charter carrier, but becoming a scheduled carrier in 2017 after purchasing NewLeaf Travel, a virtual airline that sold tickets using Flair aircraft. Since then, Flair has transformed themselves into their own ULCC, currently serving 10 destinations across Canada with a fleet of Boeing 737-400 aircraft. I've seen mixed reviews about Flair, so once I saw a good deal from Calgary, I jumped on it to check out the Flair experience and to fly on a 737-400, another aircraft type I've never flown on. Enjoy this trip report on one of Canada's newer airlines, from Calgary, Alberta to Winnipeg, Manitoba!

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Engines: 2x CFMI CFM56-3C1 
Registration: C-FLHE
Route: Calgary (YYC) - Winnipeg (YWG)
Callsign: FLAIR 136
Runway used: 35R (YYC) - 31 (YWG)
Date filmed: July 2018
